p: The essential oil extracted from leaves of Co. grandis shows promising larvicidal activity against three mosquito species An. stephensi, Ae. aegypti and Cu. quinquefasciatus, ( Table 2). The LC 50 and LC 90 values against early fourth instar larvae of An. stephensi, after 12 and 24 h of exposure were calculated to be 72.60 and 169.90 and 39.41 and 123.24ppm, respectively. Similarly, LC 50 and LC 90 values against early fourth instar larvae of Ae. aegypti after 12 and 24h of exposure were calculated to be 83.25 and 191.60 and 48.20 and 131.84ppm, respectively. The values were marginally higher with early fourth instar larvae of Cx. quinquefasciatus than the other two species under identical conditions ( Table 2).
